title: Aggravate
data:
- *This article is about the monster spell and effect. For the property, see [aggravate monster](/wiki/Aggravate_monster "Aggravate monster").*

**Aggravation** is an effect that can occur from various items or other actions, including a [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell") by the same name.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)
  - [1.1 Monsters](#Monsters)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 Messages](#Messages)
- [4 Variants](#Variants)
  - [4.1 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
- [5 References](#References)

## Description

When an aggravation effect occurs, all monsters on the level are awakened, including those in the [meditating](/wiki/Meditating "Meditating") state, and [paralyzed](/wiki/Paralyzed "Paralyzed") monsters have a 1⁄5 chance of being un-paralyzed.[\[1\]](#cite_note-wizaggro-1)

One of the primary means of encountering the aggravation effect is the monster spell: Aggravation is a non-directed spell that can be used by any [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that casts [mage spells](/wiki/Mage_spell "Mage spell") and is at least [level](/wiki/Monster_level "Monster level") 14.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-aggrocast-3) The effect also occurs under the following circumstances:

- [Quaffing](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff") a [cursed](/wiki/Cursed "Cursed") [potion of invisibility](/wiki/Potion_of_invisibility "Potion of invisibility"), whether or not you are already [invisible](/wiki/Invisible "Invisible").[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

- One of the effects of the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor")'s harassment.[\[1\]](#cite_note-wizaggro-1)

- The shrieking of a [shrieker](/wiki/Shrieker "Shrieker"), which occurs while it is adjacent to your character or else you [chat](/wiki/Chat "Chat") to one.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)[\[6\]](#cite_note-6) You can also shriek via the [#monster](/wiki/Monster_\(command\) "Monster (command)") [extended command](/wiki/Extended_command "Extended command") if you are [polymorphed](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") into a shrieker, which has the same effect unless you are trapped in [solid rock](/wiki/Solid_rock "Solid rock").[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

- Trying to [turn undead](/wiki/Turn_undead "Turn undead") via the extended command if any of the following is true:

  - Your god is angry.[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)
  - You are in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom").[\[9\]](#cite_note-9)
  - You are a non-[chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic") character, and are [polymorphed](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") into an [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead") monster or [major demon](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon").[\[10\]](#cite_note-10)[\[11\]](#cite_note-11)

- A possible negative effect from [sitting](/wiki/Sit "Sit") on a [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne") while you have negative [Luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck").[\[12\]](#cite_note-12)

- A possible negative effect from failing to read a [spellbook](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook").[\[13\]](#cite_note-13)

A cursed [potion of monster detection](/wiki/Potion_of_monster_detection "Potion of monster detection") has a similar effect when quaffed that also awakens and unparalyzes monsters, but does not clear the meditating state.

On levels that include the [Wizard's Tower](/wiki/Wizard%27s_Tower "Wizard's Tower") floors, the aggravation effect will only affect monsters on the same side of the tower as you: if you are outside the tower, aggravation will not affect monsters inside the tower, and vice versa.[\[14\]](#cite_note-14)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

As part of [commit f930a12f](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/f930a12fba63e77d63b7a266d517f7ea038cd464), which reworks [erinyes](/wiki/Erinyes "Erinyes") to better emulate the Furies they are based on, they can aggravate monsters when hostile and in proximity to your character.

### Monsters

Monsters can also be affected by aggravation when drinking a cursed potion of invisibility, or rarely fighting a shrieker (typically via [conflict](/wiki/Conflict "Conflict") or with a pet shrieker). When this happens, the monster's location is displayed to you, and you are brought back to consciousness if you were unconscious at the time.[\[15\]](#cite_note-aggroyou-15)[\[16\]](#cite_note-alarm-16)

## Strategy

Deliberate aggravation is quite useful in order to remotely wake up a [meditating](/wiki/Meditating "Meditating"), [covetous](/wiki/Covetous "Covetous") monster: you can do so while standing on the up [stair](/wiki/Stair "Stair") (or down [ladder](/wiki/Ladder "Ladder") in [Vlad's](/wiki/Vlad%27s_Tower "Vlad's Tower") or [the Wizard's](/wiki/Wizard%27s_Tower "Wizard's Tower") towers) in order to prevent the covetous monster from escaping. Players stock cursed potions of invisibility for this purpose, though in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom") (which excludes Vlad's Tower), [Knights](/wiki/Knight "Knight") and [Priests](/wiki/Priest "Priest") may [turn undead](/wiki/Turn_undead "Turn undead") to aggravate [unique demons](/wiki/Unique_demon "Unique demon") and the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor").

## Messages

- You feel that monsters are aware of your presence.

  The aggravation monster spell was cast.[\[3\]](#cite_note-aggrocast-3)

- For some reason, \<monster>'s presence is known to you.  
  You feel aggravated at \<monster>.

  A monster triggered an aggravation effect.[\[15\]](#cite_note-aggroyou-15)

- Aggravated, you are jolted into full consciousness.

  As above, but this replaces the second line if you were unconscious when the effect occurred.[\[16\]](#cite_note-alarm-16)

## Variants

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), the aggravation effect can also occur as part of harassment from the [Stranger](/wiki/Stranger "Stranger") or [Illurien of the Myriad Glimpses](/wiki/Illurien_of_the_Myriad_Glimpses "Illurien of the Myriad Glimpses").

The aggravation effect informs all monsters on the level of your location, which is not known by default in these variants compared to *NetHack*.
